page.title: 02DIFFERENT KINDS OF FARMING
page.content: It is 5th June 1985. Kate Joels and Rachel Lumb went up to{Sandy Lane}to interview the farmer. We asked him about farming. {SHEEP}_September is the mating season. The lambs are born in Spring. Once fattened, they are taken to market in July. Summer is the clipping time, they stack the fleece and send it to market. {HENS}_Battery hens, deep litter, free range. Different colour yokes are used e.g blue, red, green etc. {PIGS}_Piglets are weaned at 8wks. At 5wks they are put in piggy boxes.20wks are fattened for slaughter, weight is 160lbs. They are killed for pork and bacon. {COWS}_The farmer buys young ones and keeps them for 6 months. They are killed the following Spring.
